I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

comments: Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns
Claire Jahns

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Professor Mansur is leaving, which is a big loss for FES--but I hope someone else picks up this class, as it was a great in depth look at how different kinds of organizations manage public and private environmental issues and concerns.

Cases were somewhat dated and repetative with readings in other classes. The last research paper was a good assignment and taught me something in a new field.The teacher was great at lecture... he was not as good at leading discussion on cases. The case discussions were dry as they were just reviewing the information in the case rather than trying to analyze it a level beyond what was in the cases.Homework #2 didn't really teach you much - just took time - was an exercise of plugging in values.

2. Erin sometimes got behind and he went really fast through explanations of challenging concepts, leaving some non-economics and non-business school students befuddled. Other than that, he was usually a really effective teacher of some tough economics material.7b,c. The TA didn't do much. I never talked with her and since she didn't even come to the class I didn't ever feel like she was available. I don't think it is fair to the students or a good idea to let TAs take the job if they can't or don't sit through the class and make themselves more available.
The first part of the course seemed rushed and sometimes the concepts were not clearly explained.

There was one or two too many assignments for this class to have a reasonable workload. For the most part, the assignments were good, but at a certain point in the semester, keeping up with the reading and doing the various assignments became monotonous and was interfering with my workload for other courses.
This course offers learning from three perspectives - lectures and quantitative topics, case studies, and finally project work. I found the three way approach was extremely helpful.
Incorporation of economic principles into thinking about the environment.

It was a really great course to expose students to the nexus of environmental policy, business strategy, and economics. I really enjoyed the mix of students from FES and SOM, who contributed to the learning in the class. I felt like it took basic economics, which I took last year, and offered a really fascinating application of those concepts in the sphere of business decision-making and economics.

-loved the text (markets and the environment)-i liked the first half of the course the best - (or better) - the economic concepts, etc.-real cases provide practical experience/knowledge of how to apply concepts
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
It discussed on the management strategy of some organizations.
The case studies.
The overview of the course subject matter.
Mansur's clear and informative lecture style and the application of broad concepts in economics to case studies. The material was well structured and the class felt neat and organized.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Could have had more resources directed towards the basic quantitative econ concepts in the beginning--moved pretty past through that part!
Revamp of readings/cases that are dated as well as better discussion of cases.

There were times when we were just trying to cover too much material and despite having done the readings to prepare for class I just didn't get what he was talking about because I didn't have the business background. And, because we were time constrained, I never felt like I learned all the concepts that we were forced to rush through. It didn't happen alot, but going more slowly and deliberately through some of those classes would be helpful.
-linking the stuff learned in the first half to the cases - more indepth / quantitative analysis of cases rather than summary/ superficial approach to understanding them.
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
Most organisations discussed were of USA and cases on evolving companies were not discussed.
The initial part of the course was too rushed
An explination of how environmental economic theory is different from classical economic theory, so that the environmental economic tools are better understood.
The workload. Assignments were a bit tedious.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both available and very helpful
The instructor was very approachable. He took off time to help me with my questions.
Good; adequate

Erin was great in class. I never tried to meet with him at his office, but I know I could have. The TA was totally absent. I never saw her or knew if she was available for office hours. I'm sure she was, but because she never came to class, I didn't know.
-both were great - both Prof Mansur and TA Claire were accessible and super helpful.
instructor: both availability and quality were good.TA: availability can be improved.
It was fine enough.
The instructor was quite available and helpful. The TA was mostly available and attempted to be helpful.
Pretty good. Mansur was generally responsive and available. I felt he gave our team project proposals short shrift.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course deals with management of the environment and offers an economics perspective. The course fits well with my program because I do not have a background in economics and it was great to have a different perspective.

Understanding the underlying economic arguments for various environmental policy choices and tradeoffs, and the relationship to business decision-making and participation in the policy-making process is key. This class was a good advanced course in the synthesis and application of economics, business, finance, environmental policy and law.
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
I got management knowledge from this course.
Excellent. For someone interested in policy analysis and design it is very relevant.

It was a great intro to the field and was a good mix of theory and practical application, including case studies. It gave me a much better understanding of how to take my environmental work and integrate it into the marketplace.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Bin requirement--but also a great class.

I do not have an economics background. But this class gave me the economics perspective to approaching strategy issues a company may have. This class fits well with my career aspirations of working as a consultant in the intersection of business and the environment.
To learn more about economic principles in enivronmental policy discussion

I was interested in learning the business and economics side of policy decision-making. What are the tradeoffs, considerations and objectives of different environmental policy tools and how can we use them most effectively to achieve desired environmental objectives.

I wanted a good background on how companies and public sector organizations think about and deal with environmental challenges and the economics of making decisions with respect to complying with given policies or not.
Because I wanted to take management course and I had not taken management courses earlier.
I'm interested in environmental policy analysis and design
Initially, to fill a bin but I got a lot more out of it than I expected.
Requirement.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, it did.
yes - although see comments above.
Yes. It was a very good class.
YES.
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
Yes
yes
I got a lot more out of it than I expected.
It was much better than I expected.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: I believe I learned more than I had expected.
Yes
Yes.
yes
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
Yes, but class participation took a significant portion for grading.
yes
I got a lot more out of it than I expected.

I got more than I expected. Honestly, I was taking it to fulfill a bin req. What I got back was a new set of knowledge that is sufficiently broad and general to be useful for me professionally. If I hadn't taken this course I wouldn't of known what I was missing.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Learned a lot by covering more ground/dividing up the work
Advantages were ability to learn from others.
No I did not.

advantages : learn a lot fromothers, different backgrounds (some FES/some SOM students so very valuable to have different perspectives)disadvantages: always difficult to coordinate, etc but nothing specific to this course that made groupwork particularly disadvantageous
Advantage: A sense of group performance for the well doing of the project. Discussion was worthy.

Advantages: everyone in the group was interested in the proyect. Disadvantages: The guidelines for the final paper were not 100% clear. Because of that, working in a group is hard because people have different expectations. Specially when they are from different schools and they are at different levels in the program.
The advantage was learning from the SOM students in the class, very useful.

The group work was poorly timed at the busiest part of everyones schedule and thru the middle of two breaks (FES and SOM break at different times). Over 4 weeks our team only had the opportunity to meet twice! Coordination was a mess. I think this project could be dropped entirely in favor of a final exam.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I am not sure if this course will be offered next fall because the instructor is leaving Yale.

Do the reading and be talkative in class. Erin likes to teach, that is obvious. So go prepared and stay engaged and you'll get alot out of the class. Erin is really brilliant and eager to share knowledge, but you have to engage with him and your classmates.
definitely take it and do the outside readings, some of them are REALLY interesting and all are relevant.
My comments have been made in the SOM evaluation.
It is a good course to have knowledge on management.
If you are not string in environmental economics, it is a good class to complement with economics of the environment.
The course if front-loaded with problem sets that proved to be difficult, beware.
